title: Disney Launches Collectible MLB Trading Cards With Topps, Featuring Disney and Pixar Characters (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Disney is getting into the MLB trading card business.  	On Sept. 24, the collectibles giant Topps will roll out the Chrome Disney Trading Card Set, a first-of-its-kind collaboration uniting Disney, Pixar and...
body:
Disney is getting into the MLB trading card business.

On Sept. 24, the collectibles giant Topps will roll out the Chrome Disney Trading Card Set, a first-of-its-kind collaboration uniting Disney, Pixar and the MLB under one glossy, collectible umbrella.

The release features a 200-card Chrome tech base set spotlighting fan-favorite Disney and Pixar characters, along with inserts ranging from hand-drawn sketch cards to authentic actor autographs. But the headline play is the debut of Mickey Mouse, Goofy and Donald Duck in official MLB trading card form â€” the first time Disney icons will be suited up in Major League uniforms.

â€œDisneyâ€™s Mickey and Friends are showing up in exciting and surprising places we love â€” bringing fans together for memorable moments,â€ Paul Gitter, executive vice president of global brand commercialization at Disney Consumer Products, tells Variety. â€œThe Topps Disney collaboration with Major League Baseball fuses storytelling, sports fandom and the enduring appeal of our iconic characters across all audiences.â€

For collectors, the three characters will serve as anchors across divisions: Mickey covers the AL and NL West, Goofy reps theÂ EastÂ divisions and Donald takes on theÂ Central. Each year, the trio will rotate through divisions, extending the chase and driving year-over-year collectibility. The 2025 release features home jerseys in the Disney Chrome set, while away uniforms will appear later this year in the Topps Chrome Update Baseball series.

Boxes range across multiple price points â€” Hobby Box ($420), Mega Box ($70), and Value Box ($40) â€” and will be available on Topps.com.

The partnership underscores the broader trend of nostalgia-driven crossovers in the collectibles market, where brands are increasingly leaning on heritage characters and cultural touchstones to energize core fans while pulling in new ones. With Disney celebrating nearly a century of animation and MLB continually seeking to expand its audience, the Topps Chrome Disney set arrives as a pitch-perfect play for both camps.

title: â€˜Bai, Baiâ€™ Director Alba Esquinas on Capturing the Pain of Losing a First Friendship: â€˜There Isnâ€™t Much Room for Innocenceâ€™
description: With â€œBai, Bai,â€ Murcia-born filmmaker Alba Esquinas turns a formative childhood memory into her debut feature, exploring the subtle but devastating rupture of a first friendship. Itâ€™s one of the ECAM...
body:
With â€œBai, Bai,â€ Murcia-born filmmaker Alba Esquinas turns a formative childhood memory into her debut feature, exploring the subtle but devastating rupture of a first friendship. Itâ€™s one of the ECAM Incubator titles, a prestigious Madrid Film School initiative that has become a key launchpad for emerging Spanish filmmakers, offering development backing, industry mentorship and access to international markets.

The story follows Ana, 12, who embarks on a long-awaited school trip to Madrid with her best friend Santi. But on the bus ride, Santi chooses to sit with someone else. That empty seat marks the beginning of a painful estrangement, as Ana confronts loneliness for the first time, far from the protection of her parents and her closest companion.

Esquinas traces the projectâ€™s origins to an image she encountered in 2021. â€œI was traveling from Murcia to AlmerÃ­a and saw graffiti on the highway that said â€˜BAI, BAI,â€™ a misspelling of â€˜bye, bye,â€™â€ she told Variety. â€œI imagined a girl painting it, knowing her best friend would see it. That way of saying goodbye led me back to my own experiences of losing a friendship.â€

For Esquinas, the subject is rarely addressed on screen. â€œIn a romantic breakup, you have rituals and guidance to help with grief. But in a friendship, especially as a child, you donâ€™t have those tools. It can feel just as traumatic, but itâ€™s often overlooked,â€ she said.

The â‚¬2 million project is produced by Alejandro GonzÃ¡lez Clemente at Mubox Studio, with financing still to be secured. â€œItâ€™s always more complicated to finance a debut feature,â€ GonzÃ¡lez acknowledged. â€œBut we believe one of the strengths of this project is Albaâ€™s sensitivity in telling stories, and the universality of the theme.â€

Visually, the director plans to balance realism with expressionism. â€œIâ€™m looking for a realistic emotional portrait, but one thatâ€™s aesthetically expressionist. Anaâ€™s emotions will define the images and sounds â€” as she accepts the end of her friendship, the settings will also accompany her, like a rite of passage,â€ Esquinas explained.

Rejecting nostalgia, she describes â€œBai, Baiâ€ as â€œa more adult coming-of-age.â€ â€œThere isnâ€™t much room for innocence. Almost from the beginning, thereâ€™s a disenchantment with reality that has more to do with an adult perspective,â€ she said. Among inspirations, she cites CÃ©line Sciammaâ€™s approach to screenwriting and Joanna Hoggâ€™s emotionally precise filmmaking.

Mubox previously collaborated with Esquinas on her short â€œOloresâ€ (â€œSmellsâ€), which premiered at Visions du RÃ©el and won the Grand Prize of Spanish Cinema at Zinebi. â€œWe loved the way she works and tells stories, so we were excited to see her next script and be part of her step into feature filmmaking,â€ GonzÃ¡lez said.

What resonated with the producers was the subtlety of the loss. â€œIt isnâ€™t about a dramatic, heartbreaking event like a death; itâ€™s about two girls drifting apart as their world begins to grow,â€ GonzÃ¡lez said. â€œItâ€™s a moment that can feel very traumatic but one weâ€™ve rarely seen portrayed on screen.â€

Citing the success of debut Spanish features such as Carla SimÃ³nâ€™s â€œSummer 1993â€ and Estibaliz Urresolaâ€™s â€œ20,000 Species of Bees,â€ Mubox is aiming to position â€œBai, Baiâ€ for both the festival circuit and international markets. â€œLosing a friendship is universal â€” everyone can relate to it. That gives us confidence in the filmâ€™s ability to connect widely,â€ GonzÃ¡lez said.

For Esquinas, the goal is to balance melancholy with hope. â€œI want the audience to embrace this disenchantment with hope, despite the shadows Ana must navigate. Accepting that nothing lasts forever is something we can apply to many aspects of our lives. The sooner we accept it, the more hope we have to navigate the losses we suffer,â€ she said.

title: Theo Von Demands Dept. of Homeland Security Remove Clip That Features Him: â€˜Keep Me Out of Your â€˜Bangerâ€™ Deportation Videosâ€™
description: Theo Von, comedian and host of popular podcast â€œThis Past Weekend,â€ objected to a video posted by the Trump administrationâ€™s Department of Homeland Security, which uses a snippet of him saying, â€œHeard you got...
body:
Theo Von, comedian and host of popular podcast â€œThis Past Weekend,â€ objected to a video posted by the Trump administrationâ€™s Department of Homeland Security, which uses a snippet of him saying, â€œHeard you got deported, dude â€” byeâ€ to promote the agencyâ€™s deportation numbers.

On Tuesday, DHS shared a 31-second video clip on X with the caption â€œBye.â€ It begins with Vonâ€™s comment then displays the claim that 2 million illegal immigrants have been deported in the first 250 days of President Trumpâ€™s second term. It also shows Trump saying, â€œThey simply stopped coming. Theyâ€™re not coming anymore,â€ before concluding with on-screen text that says â€œLEAVE NOWâ€ over a plane on takeoff.

â€œYooo DHS i didnt approve to be used in this,â€ Von wrote on X on Tuesday evening, quoting the DHS post with the video. â€œI know you know my address so send a check. And please take this down and please keep me out of your â€˜bangerâ€™ deportation videos.â€

Von continued, â€œWhen it comes to immigration my thoughts and heart are alot more nuanced than this video allows. Bye!â€

Reps for DHS did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

On his podcast, Von has hosted such guests from all sides of the political aisle, including Donald Trump, JD Vance, Mark Cuban, Bernie Sanders, Tucker Carlson, Joe Rogan as well as fellow comedians Shane Gillis, Nikki Glaser and Pete Davidson. Von has two stand-up comedy specials on Netflix, â€œRegular Peopleâ€ (2021) and â€œNo Offenseâ€ (2016).

Von, together with David Spade, is starring in and producing buddy-comedy movie â€œBusboys,â€ which they wrote and are self-financing. The film is set in an Arizona border town and follows â€œDavidâ€ and â€œTheo,â€ two friends who â€œthink becoming waiters will solve all of their problems. They are wrong,â€ according to the logline. Von is repped by WME.

Pictured above: Theo Von attends â€œSNL50: The Homecoming Concertâ€ at New York Cityâ€™s Radio City Music Hall Feb. 14, 2025.

title: Robert De Niro to Receive Romeâ€™s Top Honor as Part of Alice in the City Festival
description: Robert De Niro will be honored with the Lupa Capitolina, the city of Romeâ€™s top honor, in tandem with the Rome Film Festivalâ€™s independently run Alice in the City sidebar, which is dedicated to films for...
body:
Robert De Niro will be honored with the Lupa Capitolina, the city of Romeâ€™s top honor, in tandem with the Rome Film Festivalâ€™s independently run Alice in the City sidebar, which is dedicated to films for children and youth.

De Niro in expected on Nov. 6 and 7 in the Italian capital where he will receive the honor from Rome mayor Roberto Gualtieri. Mixing business with kudos, De Niro will concurrently be in the Eternal City to attend the inauguration of his Nobu Hotel Roma on the iconic Via Veneto, the latest retreat from chef Nobu Matsuhisa, De Niro and producer Meir Teper, who will all be on hand.

They will perform the so-called Kagami-Biraki ceremony, in which the lid of the sake barrel is broken open with a wooden mallet and the sake is served to everyone present as a symbol of harmony and good fortune, in front of the hotel on Via Veneto, of â€œLa Dolce Vitaâ€ fame. The event will be part of the Alice in the Cityâ€™s new extension called â€œFuori Salaâ€ which translates as â€œoutside the cinema.â€ The sidebar includes meetings, readings and presentations related to cinema and books for audiences of all ages held in October and November.

Meanwhile Alice in the City on Wed. also announced it will open on Oct. 15 with U.S. director Ben Leonbergâ€™s breakout horror movie â€œGood Boyâ€ that launched from SXSW and features a family dog named Indy who must protect his sickly owner from a sinister supernatural force. Other Alice in the City highlights include family drama â€œAnemoneâ€ directed by Ronan Day-Lewis that brought his father Daniel Day-Lewis, who co-wrote the film, out of retirement after 8 years â€“ both will be attending â€“ and Iraqi director Hasan Hadiâ€™s compassionate directorial debut â€œThe Presidentâ€™s Cakeâ€ about Iraqi children living under Saddam Hussein.

title: Demi Moore Brings Hollywood Glamour to Milan Fashion Week With Star-Studded Premiere of Spike Jonze and Halina Reijnâ€™s Gucci Short Film â€˜The Tigerâ€™
description: Demi Mooreâ€˜s first film role since her Oscar-nominated turn in â€œThe Substanceâ€ is playing the matriarch of an alternative-reality Gucci family in Spike Jonze and Halina Reijnâ€˜s trippy short â€œThe Tiger.â€  	In...
body:
Demi Mooreâ€˜s first film role since her Oscar-nominated turn in â€œThe Substanceâ€ is playing the matriarch of an alternative-reality Gucci family in Spike Jonze and Halina Reijnâ€˜s trippy short â€œThe Tiger.â€

In the 30-minute film â€” which premiered in Milan on Tuesday night to kick off fashion week â€” Moore portrays Barbara Gucci, the fictional head of Gucci International who also owns the state of California. To celebrate her birthday, Barbara throws a dinner party for her children (Edward Norton, Elliot Page and Keke Palmer) and a Vanity Fair journalist (Ed Harris) who is eager to see behind Barbaraâ€™s facade. But when psychedelics get involved, Barbaraâ€™s pristine reputation is threatened and the family is forced to confront their own imperfections. The cast of â€œThe Tigerâ€ also includes Alia Shawkat, Julianne Nicholson, Heather Lawless, Ronny Chieng, Kendall Jenner and Alex Consani.

Oscar winner Jonze and breakout â€œBabygirlâ€ director Reijn meld their respective styles seamlessly in the short, balancing tongue-in-cheek satire with moments of high tension amid mind-boggling visuals. Similarly to her â€œThe Substanceâ€ role, Moore excels at playing a woman on the brink â€” and if not for the Gucci-centric storyline and wardrobe, one could easily forget that the film is meant to be promotional.

â€œThe Tigerâ€ features clothes from Demnaâ€™s first collection as Gucci artistic director â€” titled â€œLa Famigliaâ€ â€” and the premiere at the Milan Stock Exchange served as a de facto fashion show, with models from the lineâ€™s campaign and a slew of celebs all strutting the brown carpet in new designs (Moore wore a particularly stunning gold-beaded gown that appeared to be very heavy). In addition to the shortâ€™s stars and directors, the glitzy premiere was also attended by Gwyneth Paltrow â€” who chatted with Moore before and after the screening â€” Jin of BTS fame, Serena Williams, Anna Wintour, David Jonsson and Alia Bhatt.

Speaking to Variety on the brown carpet, Page called working with Moore â€œincredible.â€

â€œDefinitely trippy, pardon the pun â€” youâ€™ll know what I mean based on the short,â€ he continued. â€œBut it was just a phenomenal experience and sheâ€™s such a wonderful person, so sweet and kind to everyone. And obviously a tremendous actor, so getting to have my days working with Demi was the best.â€

Nicholson, fresh off an Emmy guest actress win for â€œHacks,â€ wore a dramatic high-collared black velvet gown to the premiere â€” the same one she wears in the short. She and Lawless play a pair of eerie, â€œShiningâ€-esque cousins who contribute to the dinner partyâ€™s downfall, and walked down the carpet together holding hands.

â€œIt felt like walking onto the set of a Fellini movie or some sort of trippy dream,â€ Nicholson said of working with Jonze and Reign. â€œIt remains, up until this moment, something Iâ€™ve never experienced before and a fantastic ride.â€

Watch â€œThe Tigerâ€ below.

title: BBC Studiosâ€™ â€˜Bluey at the Cinema: Letâ€™s Play Chefâ€™ Sets Italian Premiere at Rome Film Festival Sidebar
description: BBC Studios has set the bigscreen Italian premiere of â€œBluey at the Cinema: Letâ€™s Play Chef Collectionâ€ at the Rome Film Festivalâ€™s independent sidebar Alice nella CittÃ  which is dedicated to younger...
body:
BBC Studios has set the bigscreen Italian premiere of â€œBluey at the Cinema: Letâ€™s Play Chef Collectionâ€ at the Rome Film Festivalâ€™s independent sidebar Alice nella CittÃ  which is dedicated to younger audiences on Oct. 18.

â€œBluey at the Cinema: Letâ€™s Play Chef Collectionâ€ is a special compilation of eight episodes â€“ including Takeaway, Fancy Restaurant, OmeletteÂ andÂ Duck Cake â€” from the hit Australian animated childrenâ€™s seriesÂ â€œBluey.â€

The one-hour compilation will go on to have a nationwide theatrical release in Italy starting on Oct. 30. before hitting theaters in Germany, France and Benelux. It previously launched in the U.K., Ireland, Spain and Poland.

Created by Joe Brumm,Â â€œBlueyâ€Â is produced by Ludo Studio for the Australian Broadcasting Corporation and co-commissioned by ABC Childrenâ€™s and BBC Studios Kids & Family which is distributing the hit TV series internationally. The collection also hails from the partnership between Piece of Magic EntertainmentÂ andÂ Vue LumiÃ¨re.

â€œFamilies across Italy will soon enjoy the special compilation on the big screen, starting with an exciting premiere at Romeâ€™s Alice nella cittÃ  festival,â€ said CeciliaÂ Persson, BBC StudiosÂ Kids & Familyâ€™s managing director, adding that bringing â€œâ€˜Blueyâ€™Â on the big screenâ€ will be celebrating the joy, laughter, and love that the series brings to children and parents alike.â€

While the â€œBlueyâ€ compilation is rolling out internationally, the anticipation for the first â€œBlueyâ€ feature film is growing. Earlier this month, BBC Studios and Walt Disney Studios announced the CG-animated feature film is already set for a global theatrical release on Aug. 6, 2027.

title: John Boyega Would Have Kept Han Solo and Luke Skywalker in â€˜Star Warsâ€™ Sequel Trilogy if He Was a Producer: I â€˜Want to Give Those Characters Way Moreâ€™
description: John Boyega isnâ€™t holding back when it comes to his thoughts on how the â€œStar Warsâ€ sequel trilogy could have been handled differently.  	Speaking at Florida Supercon 2025 in Miami Beach, Boyega â€” who played...
body:
John Boyega isnâ€™t holding back when it comes to his thoughts on how the â€œStar Warsâ€ sequel trilogy could have been handled differently.

Speaking at Florida Supercon 2025 in Miami Beach, Boyega â€” who played former Stormtrooper Finn across â€œThe Force Awakens,â€ â€œThe Last Jediâ€ and â€œThe Rise of Skywalkerâ€ â€” offered a candid take on what he would have done if he had been a producer on the films from the beginning. When asked by an audience member during his spotlight panel what changes he would make to remake the sequels, Boyega delivered a blunt assessment of the franchiseâ€™s creative choices.

â€œIf I was a producer on â€˜Star Warsâ€™ from the beginning, you would have had a whole completely different thing,â€ Boyega said, according to Popverse. â€œIt would be mad. First of all, weâ€™re not getting rid of Han Solo, Luke Skywalker, all these people. Weâ€™re not doing that. The first thing weâ€™re going to do is fulfill their story, fulfill their legacy. Weâ€™re going to make a good moment of handing on the baton.â€

Boyega also took aim at the power scaling of new characters in the sequels. â€œOur new characters will not be OPâ€™d [overpowered] in these movies,â€ he said. â€œThey wonâ€™t just grab stuff and know what to do with it. No. Youâ€™ve got to struggle like every other character in this franchise. Iâ€™d do that.â€

Beyond character development, Boyega outlined a different creative approach that would have drawn from the expanded universe of â€œStar Warsâ€ storytelling. â€œIâ€™d look to the Old Republic stories and see what we can add to the continuation of that. I would definitely want to see Force Unleashed stories in there,â€ he said. â€œI would try to expand the â€˜Star Warsâ€™ universe as much as possible while respecting the lore. If weâ€™re expanding the lore, we have to do it within the respective boundaries that stay true.â€

The actor was particularly critical of Luke Skywalkerâ€™s arc in â€œThe Last Jedi,â€ where the character appeared as a Force projection during the filmâ€™s climax. â€œBut Luke Skywalker wouldnâ€™t be disappearing on a rock. Hell no. Standing there and heâ€™s, like, a projector? I would want to give those characters way more way more.â€

title: Nepal Drama â€˜Shaktiâ€™ Finds Distribution With Buffalo 8 as Country Embraces Change (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Buffalo 8 has secured distribution rights to â€œShakti,â€ the debut narrative feature from Nepali-American filmmaker Nani Sahra Walker, in a seven-year deal covering the U.S., Canada and U.K. markets.  	The...
body:
Buffalo 8 has secured distribution rights to â€œShakti,â€ the debut narrative feature from Nepali-American filmmaker Nani Sahra Walker, in a seven-year deal covering the U.S., Canada and U.K. markets.

The Kathmandu-set drama follows a determined single mother whose nine-year-old daughter falls mysteriously ill. When medical professionals canâ€™t provide answers, she seeks help from a local shaman, setting both mother and daughter on a journey toward redemption.

Walker, who previously served as executive producer at LA Times Studios, draws parallels between her film and Nepalâ€™s recent political transformation. â€œRecently in Nepal, young people dismantled the government and ushered in the countryâ€™s first female prime minister who has been fighting for womenâ€™s rights for decades. â€˜Shaktiâ€™ is grounded in that same spirit, carrying both the spirit of resistance and change,â€ she said.

â€œâ€˜Shaktiâ€™ confronts fading global attention on sexual violence, caste injustice, and the corruption fueling Nepalâ€™s biggest protests in decades. Itâ€™s both a response to Nepalâ€™s urgent call for action and a universal story of justice and resilience,â€ Walker added.

Walker brings notable credits to the project, having overseen award-winning short documentaries at LA Times Studios, including â€œThe Last Repair Shop,â€ which claimed the Academy Award for Best Documentary Short in 2024. Her 2012 debut documentary â€œOther Nature,â€ exploring LGBTQ rights in Nepal, played at BFI Flare, Outfest, Frameline and dozens of international festivals.

Behind the camera, acclaimed Japanese cinematographer Keiko Nakahara lensed the project. Nakaharaâ€™s decade-plus career spans work on â€œMary Kom,â€ â€œTanhaji: The Unsung Warriorâ€ and â€œThe Jane Austen Book Clubâ€ across India, Hollywood and Japan.

The cast includes Laxmi Bardewa (â€œBulbulâ€), Menuka Pradhan (â€œSailiâ€), Shristi Shrestha (â€œThe Red Suitcaseâ€) and Polina Oli. Executive producers are Vrushali Satarkar, Snehal Fulzele, Matthew Helderman, Luke Taylor, Grady Craig, Gannon Kenney and Rakesh Mehra, whose credits include â€œThe Warriorâ€ and â€œSeven Years in Tibet.â€

â€œShaktiâ€ will world premiere at the Heartland International Film Festival in Indianapolis before screening in the New American Perspectives lineup at the Hawaii International Film Festival. Additional festival stops include the Tasveer South Asian Film Festival in Seattle and the Female Eye Film Festival in Toronto.

The project received backing from ARRIâ€™s International Support Program, a global initiative supporting emerging filmmakers. Production also marked the Nepal debut of the ARRI ALEXA 35 camera system.

title: Pingyao Project Jury Stresses Market Viability, Original Voices
description: The 9th Pingyao International Film Festival Project Market jurors stressed the importance of balancing creative originality with market feasibility at a press conference on the festivalâ€™s opening day. This...
body:
The 9th Pingyao International Film Festival Project Market jurors stressed the importance of balancing creative originality with market feasibility at a press conference on the festivalâ€™s opening day.

This year, the festival received 872 submissions, of which the Pingyao Project Promotion (PPP) program presents 16 projects in various stages of development and the Literary Picturized Project (LPP) presents 15 works spanning from short fiction to full-length novels, representing a diverse array of contemporary Chinese literature available for screen adaptation. Awards including the Creativity Prize, Humanitarian Spirit Award and Commercial Potential Prize will be handed out, alongside the Momo Script Award.

Director Zhang Yang, whose credits include â€œShowerâ€ and â€œPaths of the Soul,â€ highlighted the need for filmmakers to articulate not only their story but also how it will translate into a distinctive cinematic style. â€œFrom my perspective, itâ€™s not only the story and characters â€” those are essential â€” but also how the director ultimately brings this script to the screen. What is the visual style? Is there a breakthrough or personal pursuit?â€ Zhang said.

Producer Ye Ting (â€œHer Story,â€ â€œHow Long Will I Love Uâ€) underscored the role of producers in shaping projects for real-world execution. â€œNo matter how strong a script is artistically, if its feasibility and market potential are very limited, then itâ€™s hard to move forward,â€ Ye said, noting that producers must define the projectâ€™s selling points and practical strategies for financing and release.

Actor, executive and long-time industry supporter Wu Yanyan, general manager of Dongfang Tianming Film and an adviser to the Wu Tianming Film Fund, observed that many of this yearâ€™s selected scripts demonstrated a high level of completeness and commercial awareness. â€œI was pleasantly surprised. Several projects are close to what the market wants, and the diversity is striking,â€ she said.

Pingyao programmer Wu Jueren pointed to the evolution of the selection process: seven preliminary jurors â€” including distributors, producers and directors â€” whittled down the field. â€œThere was a huge workload. But we saw a wide range: projects from experienced directors and completely fresh voices. The genres were very diverse,â€ Wu noted.

Questions of budget feasibility also loomed large. â€œIf a director has only made short films but reports a multimillion budget, then the feasibility is low,â€ Zhang cautioned. Wu Yanyan added that most projects this year showed realistic financial awareness, with budgets largely under the RMB10 million ($1.4 million) mark.

The jury stressed the importance of originality and timeliness. â€œWhat matters most with new directors is new ideas, new thinking,â€ said Ye. â€œOriginality is the strength of emerging filmmakers, often tied to their life experience and urgent desire to express something of the present moment.â€

The Project Market has become a key industry strand at Pingyao, with previous selections including â€œJourney to the Westâ€ and â€œLighting Up the Starsâ€ going on to full release. Festival organizers noted that several other past projects are in post-production and set to reach audiences soon.

The 9th Pingyao Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon International Film Festival runs Sept. 24â€“30, in Pingyao, Shanxi, China. Acclaimed filmmakerÂ Jia Zhangke, a leading figure of the Sixth Generationâ€™ movement of Chinese cinema, established the festival in his home province of Shanxi.

title: Whatevergroup and Mutant Koala Pictures Form Whatever Pictures, Readying to â€˜Answer to New Challenges of the Funding Situation in Finlandâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Finlandâ€™s production companies Whatevergroup â€“ known for Elisa Viihdeâ€™s crime series â€œEvilsideâ€ â€“ and Mutant Koala Pictures have merged, launching Whatever Pictures.  	Described as a film and TV production...
body:
Finlandâ€™s production companies Whatevergroup â€“ known for Elisa Viihdeâ€™s crime series â€œEvilsideâ€ â€“ and Mutant Koala Pictures have merged, launching Whatever Pictures.

Described as a film and TV production company and scripted studio â€œwith global ambition and northern soul,â€ it will see these â€œtwo Finnish scripted indies working side by side in the countryâ€™s far north,â€ focusing on original productions, co-productions, providing production services and post-production coordination.

Headquartered in Oulu, Whatever Pictures will â€œblend tech-savvy entrepreneurial drive with the grit of the Arcticâ€ and draw inspiration from the â€œextreme environments of its surroundings; the harsh winters, midnight sun and untamed wilderness.â€ All this will shape their narratives, â€œimbuing them with tension, resilience and unexpected humor.â€

â€œThe merger is a culmination of a long process. We are in a stronger position to answer to new challenges of the funding situation in Finland but the process started from the will to find good partners. Together, we have broader shoulders,â€ the team toldÂ VarietyÂ in a shared statement.Â 

Whatevergroup and Mutant Koala Pictures will remain as sub-labels of the Whatever Pictures family and act as service and production partners.

â€œWe will focus on excellent writing, searching for time and resources to focus on stories on their first stage in order to bring the best fiction to the world.â€

The companyâ€™s upcoming slate includes thrillers, mysteries, dramas, comedies and high-end documentaries. Among new projects is â€œTorna a Surriento,â€ a European co-production with Glassriver in Iceland, Rein Film in Norway and Viola Films in Italy for Finlandâ€™s YLE, Icelandic streamer Siminn and Italyâ€™s RAI.Â 

In the show, a street-smart Neapolitan hustler inherits a remote estate in Finnish Lapland. He sees it as a quick payday until heâ€™s forced to stay, clashing with the Sami community and falling for a fierce reindeer herder.

Action thriller â€œTransporter,â€ set over one day in northernÂ Finland when a donor heart is hijacked during transport, is also on the way. Directed by Jussi Hiltunen (â€œBordertown,â€ â€œArctic Circleâ€), it will be showcased during industry event Finnish Film Affair in Helsinki.Â 

â€œOur job up here is equal parts grit and ambition: crossing a swamp on Tuesday and a red carpet on Friday are part of the same week,â€ said CEO Antti Kaarlela.Â Â 

Creative producer Jukka Vidgren added: â€œCreating stories people want to watch is what we have done separately for a long time â€“ in Finland, across Scandinavia, around the globe and now, collectively. We believe the best stories are the ones worth sharing everywhere.â€

Antti Kairakari (creative producer), Pia Ervasti (CFO/line producer), Aleksi Puranen (head of development) and Petteri Staven (VFX supervisor) will round out the team.Â 

â€œWe know the North, we know our craft and we believe the extremes we live with every day â€“ light, dark, isolation, humor â€“ are the perfect foundation for stories that resonate everywhere,â€ said Kaarlela.Â Â

title: Hannah in 'Journey to the Center of the Earth' 'Memba Her?!
description: Icelandic actress Anita Briem was in her mid 20s when she was cast to play Hannah in the 2008 family/adventure film "Journey to the Center of the Earth." Guess what she looks like now!
body:
Hannah In Journey to the Center of the Earth 'Memba Her?!

Published September 24, 2025 12:01 AM PDT

Icelandic actress Anita Briem was in her mid-20s when she was cast to play Hannah -- the fearless and independent "mountain guide" and daughter of the famous volcanologist -- in the 2008 family/adventure film "Journey to the Center of the Earth."

Anita shared the big screen with Josh Hutcherson as the only child who's being looked after by his Uncle, Sean and Brendan Fraser as Sean's quick-thinking Uncle and professor, Trevor.

Other actors in the movie include Jean Michel ParÃ© and Kaniehtiio Horn.

Briem is also known for playing Queen Jane Seymour on "The Tudors."

Guess what she looks like now!

title: Sexy Studs In Speedos Guess Who!
description: Sexy Studs                          In Speedos                          Guess Who!                                                                Published September 23, 2025 4:20 PM...
body:

title: Diddy Sued by Longtime Stylist Deonte Nash For Sexual Battery
description: DIDDY                          SUED BY STYLIST DEONTE NASH                          ... For Sexual Battery, Human Trafficking & More                                                               ...
body:
DIDDY SUED BY STYLIST DEONTE NASH ... For Sexual Battery, Human Trafficking & More

Published September 24, 2025 4:35 AM PDT | Updated September 24, 2025 5:45 AM PDT

Diddy is facing a stunning lawsuit ahead of his sentencing ... the mogul's long-time stylist Deonte Nash is suing him for sexual battery, human trafficking and more.

According to new court docs -- obtained by TMZ -- lawyers for Deonte claim Diddy turned his dream of becoming a celebrity stylist into a "nightmare" ... one he was "forced to endure nearly every single day" during the roughly 10 years he worked for Diddy.

The docs go on to say ... "The horrors Mr. Nash experienced continue to plague him even after his employment ended."

Deonte's legal team claims Diddy -- through his employment -- subjected him to "a decade of sexual and physical assault, sexual and verbal harassment, trafficking, degradation and humiliation, threats to his life and well-being, stalking, control, and psychological manipulation."

The lawsuit outlines several harrowing incidents of Diddy allegedly assaulting Deonte ... including a party in 2013 or 2014 where he apparently exposed himself to Nash in front of other employees. It also claims Diddy repeatedly groped Deonteâ€™s body in a sexual way without consent.

Diddy allegedly made â€œunwanted, inappropriate, sexually chargedâ€ remarks to Deonte while they worked together ... with his lawyers claiming Diddy was fixated on Deonteâ€™s sexuality and brought it up constantly in front of friends and colleagues. The degrading comments, they say, left Deonte feeling objectified and uncomfortable.

Whatâ€™s more ... Deonteâ€™s lawyers cite several occasions where Diddy was allegedly physically violent -- and apparently made it clear Deonte was only alive because he allowed it.

The stylist's lawyers say Diddy allegedly used his power -- and threats of harm -- to compel Deonte to do his bidding and keep him under his control.

The docs claim Deonte has allegedly continued to receive threats even after his employment ... and he still does not feel safe.

TMZ.com

You'll recall ... Deonte testified during Diddy's criminal trial -- and when Diddy's attorney asked if he was considering a civil lawsuit, he replied, "No, Iâ€™m focused on getting out of here." When asked if he retained counsel to consider suing Diddy, Deonte said he has lawyers "to protect me."

Nashâ€™s lawsuit calls for compensatory and punitive damages ... and heâ€™s demanding a jury trial.

title: Jordon Hudson Appears to Be Working on Snake-Themed Entertainment Project
description: Jordon Hudson                          Snake-Themed Entertainment Project In The Works?!?                                                                Published September 24, 2025 12:30 AM...
body:
Jordon Hudson Snake-Themed Entertainment Project In The Works?!?

Published September 24, 2025 12:30 AM PDT

Legal documents TMZ Sports has obtained appear to indicate Jordon Hudson has her sights set on making an entertainment project with some reptile themes.

According to a filing in Massachusetts, Hudson -- the daughter of a fisherman -- created an LLC called "Spring Street Seafood Company" late last month.

A description of the business states it intends to produce a written and audio-visual work tentatively titled "Razor (Ophidian's Version)."

No word yet exactly what that entails, but ophidian, of course, is a word relating to snakes -- creatures Hudson has embraced ever since she began catching flak for dating Bill Belichick.

The 24-year-old has been spotted in serpent-like prints multiple times over the last year -- including this past Saturday, when she rocked what looked like a snakeskin mini-skirt.

She appears to be using snakes in a similar fashion to the way Taylor Swift famously embraced them -- though, again, it's unclear how they might factor into Hudson's apparently planned work.

Hudson, who's been dating Belichick for over two years, is the owner of multiple LLCs -- and is no stranger to laying the groundwork to get projects off the ground.
